alert.note: Alert for Camden; Laclede; Pulaski; Texas; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 11:55AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Wright, eastern Laclede, southern Pulaski, northwestern Texas and southeastern Camden Counties through 1245 PM CDT... At 1155 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Richland to 13 miles east of Lebanon to 16 miles east of Conway. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Leonard Wood... Waynesville... St. Robert... Richland... Stoutland... Huggins... Plato... Twin Bridges... Competition... Manes... Devil`s Elbow... Hazelton... Lynchburg... Graff... Sleeper... Falcon... Success... Laquey... Roby... Ozark Springs... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 133 and 165. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for central, south central, southwestern and east central Missouri.
